Subject: [junit] Stubbing with JUnit





Dear Sir/Mam,

I am using JUnit under Netbeans because I was looking for a nice and easy
way to
test things.
I really like the ability to create suites for regression testing etc.

The only thing I cannot find out is the way of stubbing?
Stubbing is when black box testing is done, and the class under test uses a
sub-class. I want to create my own sub-class and controll the return values
of
that class. How can this be done and controlled from within the JUnit
framework?
The dumb way would be re-writing the sub-class myself with additional
controlling methods, but I am looking for a more automatic and general
approach.

Can anyone help, or does anyone has any experience with stubs?

Jan Rademakers
jan.rademakers@...
